website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a Baby Jogger but watching your budget, this basic but reliable model is the one to pick.
pros: Baby Jogger quality at a fraction of the price- boasts lightweight design weighing less than 15 pounds
Has a padded multi-position reclining seat and UV 50+ canopy
cons: It lacks the bells and whistles of other Baby Jogger strollers we reviewed, but it's a solid deal

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Safety issue.
customer_reviews.text: DO. NOT. BUY. Middle joint malfunctioned, dropping my little one to the concrete where he slammed the back of his head. I had no other issues with the stroller until his happened. Out of nowhere. The stroller was locked. This stroller has not been on the market for a year yet. Baby Jogger , you need to address and fix this issue right away. Had to take baby to ER. Horrific and scary. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Ab. M.

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this stroller. Yes it is compact, but your child looks like he’s strapped to a board. There is no space for the child’s behind. I spent $200 for this. Now I have to spend $250 for a travel stroller with a more comfortable seat for my 1 year old. It was great folding up the stroller and tossing it in overhead bins on planes or in the trunk of a car, but that came at the expense of my son’s comfort. I’ve had the stoller six months and flown three times with it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Roscoe

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller except seat is too shallow
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars if the seat was 2 inches deeper. It's just too shallow. Too bad because almost all the other features are great: compact, easy fold, maneuverable with one hand, and decent storage for such a small stroller. It isn't super easy to unfold, however. You have to pull the front and back wheels away from each other using two hands, so it's awkward.
customer_reviews.author: polecat

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Super light and easy to fold and transport * Comes with a transport bag. The ultimate travel stroller! * Good swivel wheels, that can be maneuvered with one handed pushing Cons: The fabric is super slick/slippery. My child slides down and gets a wedgie on the strap. *The seat is very shallow, in addition to being slippery, its hard for him to keep his bottom in the seat. *The seat back is not very tall. My 5 month old baby is only 3 inches away from the top of the seat back. The canopy has additional head clearance, but if a child is to sleep, he/she won't have any solid surface for its head!
customer_reviews.author: KittytoTigerTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Buy immediately
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant We have been looking for a stroller that we can travel with that can be taken on the plane and stored in overhead. So many out that were far too expensive for us then we discovered city select tour. We already have the double city select stroller and love it so we knew this wouldn’t disappoint. It’s is very easy to fold and store, comes with backpack style travel bag. Super light weight, very easy to maneuver. We especially love that it can recline and has an extended hood to really shade our girls. Comfortable and easy to cleaned also. We absolutely love this travel stroller and for such an amazing price
customer_reviews.author: Gemma Hart

customer_reviews.title: Baby Jogger City Tour
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller. Pushes like a dream and folds up so easily and so small. Love that it includes a back pack carrying case. This will be perfect for travel and to keep in my smaller SUV. I'm hoping to use this as my regular stroller. My only problem is I wish that the seat was a bit bigger. I have smaller children but I could see it being an issue for taller, bigger children. Overall, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rachibby33

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stroller no regrets here
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome for a small stroller! I honestly have no complaints what so ever about it. My 2 year old fits great in here and the shallow seat doesn't really bother too much. We added a skiphop parent organizer to the handle that doesn't need to be removed while folded or in the backpack it comes with to store the stroller. For the children's cup holder we are using a brica cup/snack pod hooked to the side which will need to be taken off before folding. And I am absolutely in love with the violet color.
customer_reviews.author: LuxeLife

customer_reviews.title: Seat Is VERY UNCOMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: So why did I give 3 stars: simply easy assembly, otherwise not happy with overall functionality. Very disappointed bcc it’s true that a 10 month baby (who’s on bigger side) was so in comfortable. The seat cannot be push to allow baby to sit up straight... it’s sets in middle.. Then reclining back doesn’t allow baby to lay down comfortably... poor baby. I couldn’t see him uncomfortable. It’s worth to buy something that has almost full recline for naps, seat that allows baby to sit up straight and pull out for legs to rest on. Maybe my stroller has functional issue... but I was not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sads

customer_reviews.title: Good travel stroller option
customer_reviews.text: This is a good travel stroller option. Downsides are it doesn’t really lay down all the way and when it’s up it sits at an awkward angle so our kid almost never actually sits against it and is always trying to sit forward. The top umbrella is tiny and doesn’t give much coverage at all, but if all your worried about is getting through the airport quickly, you’ll be fine. It folds up pretty easily, but can be a little more challenging to unfold as time goes on. It’s the smallest travel stroller I’ve used and will serve you well for the basic of getting your kid through the airport with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: We took this stroller on our trip to Europe and couldn't be more happy with it! We got so many complements when people saw how compact it folds especially in crowded restaurants. It's so easy for air travel. Cannot recommend this enough! It feels almost as sturdy as my full size city mini GT. And held up really well along the cobble stone streets of Rome for a week!
customer_reviews.author: Gina R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this stroller to go and visit family on the other side of the country for 2 weeks. Easy to fold up and set up. (Even for the grandparents) Very light. It fits in the overhead compartment of the plane so we didn't have to check it in. Handled well in airport. It's not the smoothest ride on a bumpy street (it's a solid tire not the air kind), but that was never our need. Our need was the convenience of moving in and out of traveling from places without hurting ourselves and space issues. I would purchase this again if anything happened to it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t sit upright and seat too shallow
customer_reviews.text: So light, so easy to move, so easy to fold, BUT doesn’t sit upright and the seat is way too shallow. I find this with all Baby Jogger strollers... why is the seat so reclined (I’d say 45 degrees) even when in the upright position?! My kids hated this seat in every stage (baby, toddler and preschooler). Also, the top straps constantly separate from the bottom straps... tough to buckle with a squirmy little one. If the seat could sit upright I would give this 5 stars even if it were too shallow and the straps Costa you separated.
customer_reviews.author: ericalynn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this stroller
customer_reviews.text: We bought this before a cross country flight! LOVE this stroller. This stroller is much more for errands, doctors office, plane trips. It did great at a full day at a zoo, but does not have the best shocks for uneven pavement if you were to go for a walk for exercise. It works great for weekly use in conjunction with our jogging stroller. Iit folds so small i just tuck it behind my son's car seat. It has much better back support and visor than an umbrella stroller. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get it
customer_reviews.text: It’s cute but so many flaws! very hard to fold, extremely small storage basket and the umbrella doesn’t stay down and isn’t very big at all. I wanted something a little better quality than the classic cheap umbrella stroller but I think even the cheap stroller would have been better at this point! And the price is definitely too high for the quality. I only gave 2 stars because it is cute and light and when you are able to fold it it is pretty compact. But no matter what I would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: amazonlover

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT Travel stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is perfect for travel. I was nervous my 2.5 year old wouldn’t fit in this. But I was pleasantly surprised to find out he fit perfectly! You can tell these strollers are high quality. Just enough room for a purse or small diaper bag on the bottom of stroller. The seat allows for your toddler to lean back and take a nap if needed. And to make it even easier for travel it folds in a snap! Not to mention it comes with an amazing travel bag. Perfect to put into and store in the overhead compartment on the plane.
customer_reviews.author: Lseog

customer_reviews.title: Great Stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. Really compact, can fit behind the front seat of a vehicle. I’ve used it for two different kids, for 2 1/2 years now. Have taken it to UK/Europe twice with no problems. Originally bought it just for traveling, but my first child loved it so much I ended up using it as my main stroller instead of my Vista from 20 months up until the child was too big for it. I had read that some people didn’t like that the seat was so shallow but I think that’s why my children really like it. It’s lower to the ground and the shallow seat allows them to see more. I really recommend this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly compact and sturdy mid size stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller it’s compact and sturdy and it’s wheels roll great on any surface. I’ve had Baby Joggers for years now and I only had trouble with a Baby Jogger lite I bought from Albee Baby where the fabric ripped. The company sent me a replacement seat with a different type of attachment and it’s fine now. These strollers have lasted for years in the past for me so I’m excited to see how it goes with this one
customer_reviews.author: Kiel Foster

customer_reviews.title: Love it, be a little too lightweight for a toddler.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little stoller and love its compact fold design. However, 3 stars because my toddler is able to tip it while strapped in. I would have gone with the next model up if I knew he'd be able to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travelling with!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stroller! We travel a LOT and this is perfect - it’s so compact when folded and the backpack is so handy for walking through airports when it’s not being used. It fits in an overhead locker - we’ve checked it into the hold and also taken it as cabin baggage no problem. The basket underneath is a good size and it’s easy to manoeuvre. One downsize is that the seat doesn’t recline so not great for naps but the positives outweigh this for me. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nia

customer_reviews.title: Folds easily, fits in overhead, small basket
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Mountain Buggy Nano for three years and love it - lightweight and folds up small. When I was looking for an inexpensive second stroller for my second kid, I bought this one. Overall its very good, though overall the Nano is better. Pros: Extremely easy to fold. Big canopy. Peek-a-boo flap. Cons: Three-piece strap makes it time consuming to strap the child in. Strap covers slip of easily. Basket is VERY small (couldn't fit my diaper bag in, which I can do in the Nano).
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR TRAVEL!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is the best for travel and everday use! We have had this stroller for 1.5 years and I wish I had bought it sooner. It has great shade coverage and good size storage basket underneath. Its super easy to fold and unfold. We take it on the plane all the time with no problems and its easy to lift up and down stairs. Also the tires seem small but they are so durable and can travel over a variety of terrains(gravel, grass, cobble stone) My only 2 complaints are thats the seat doesnt recline flat and that you have to purchase the cup holder separately. STILL WORTH IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Swartz

customer_reviews.title: Best compact stroller in the market & fits overhead cabinet
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best compact stroller in the market. Prior to owning this, we'd a GB stroller which was discontinued. We looked the GB Pockit which was small but very flimsy. This Baby Jogger is a light weight Baby Jogger City Select which we love. Product is durable and you can easily close it with one hand. We often carry this with us on planes as it fits above the overhead cabin.
customer_reviews.author: Captain G

customer_reviews.title: Baby jogger!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact for traveling long distance and around the city. It can fit in a cab. Nice storage backpack even for a man of 5”1. Just comfortable on back of with some weight. Baby jogger has always offered great products. I ordered their convertible car seats for the first time and love it! I got a great deal for them like this stroller. It is a beautiful red which stands out among the rest. Such a special gift.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi R-Y

customer_reviews.title: The only good thing about this stroller is price.
customer_reviews.text: In general very regretted that purchased this stroller. First it arrived defective, second of all the stroller was super uncomfortable for the baby especially in the seating position. It doesn't comes with belly bar. We ordered one on amazon and it didn't fit, coudn't find the one that would work. Storage room is super tine. After all the struggle we returned it back , the only good thing about this stroller is price, overall wouldn't recumbent to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Daria H.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing “like new”
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving 2 stars because I purchased a “like new” open box city tour. When I opened it you could tell that it was VERY used. Definitely was purchased for a vacation than returned. There are Dings/marks on the frame of the stroller, wheels were used outside and for a good amount of time not just a test run in the house, sand is in and around the wheels/brake pedal, brake pedal is scratched and the fabric has marks. Definitely NOT as advertised. However, the fold is amazing and it has amazing maneuverability.
customer_reviews.author: courtney mooney

customer_reviews.title: Great, but a newer version has been released
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing stroller and your purchase choice will come down to price vs features. For me, the new features that matter are: There as a leg rest that locks up and down, the back can tilt farther back for napping, and the new carry bag (for travel) is easier to get the stroller into. If those features are worth the price, get the newer one, if not, this one is still one of the best travel strollers ever made.
customer_reviews.author: D. Herder

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a light weight stroller for my toddler for our Disneyland trip. It was perfect!!! Super easy to fold and put away for the tram ride. It reclines a lot more than expected for those nap times!! Also love that it provides a lot of shade for my son. The only down fall is the lack of space in the basket but other than that I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Mishell D

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stroller
customer_reviews.text: we were looking for a long time a small stroller but more comfortable than an umbrella stroller, and this model was a fantastic choice. Easy to fold and small for put in a car without fulfilling the car's trunk. Storage space is small but is a stroller not a wagon. The only significant problem that I see it is the stroller is not comfortable when the baby try to sleep, but is a stroller, for move the baby not a portable bassinet, but would be nice to have this feature too. The quality of the product is very good with exception of the belt. wheels are super good, never gets stuck and have a good maneuverabilty.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Araya

customer_reviews.title: This is the best folding stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is the best folding stroller!! We live in downtown Seattle and have a 3.5 year old who likes to walk until he gets to tired. This can fold into its backpack and be carried along until we need it and is so much more comfortable to use than a little umbrella stroller, especially for my 6' husband.
customer_reviews.author: Taura K. Betts

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative for an airplane but not the best
customer_reviews.text: It is a great stroller! Good quality and design. It is very easy to fold and it is small enough to be used as a carry on. Cons: the seat is very small, not deep enough. My baby is 6 months old and his legs would be hanging off the stroller. The leg rest cannot be adjusted. The recline is fine; but with the small seat it is not very comfortable for a tall child. I ordered other 2 strollers (Summer infant and ZOE) and I’m keeping the ZOE! (Seat is deeper, canopy offers more coverage + lots of accesories!!).
customer_reviews.author: Momof15month

customer_reviews.title: You know it's a good stroller when even the dad's can use it!
customer_reviews.text: Do you have a small child that sits in a stroller? Does said child like to get out of the stroller? Would you like to have your hands free when they are OUT of the stroller without pushing the stroller off of a cliff??? Well then here you go!! Seriously, though, a friend had this stroller and raved about it and recommended it. We bought it and are not sure how we lived without it before. Worth every penny and it is so easy to open up and close, I've gotten to the point I can pretty much do it with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Good for travel
customer_reviews.text: Great travel friendly stroller with a book bag to help free up your hands. My only qualm which was at first two is the fact that e buckle on the left side of the harness doesn’t snap together before affixing it to the crotch buckle. It’s always coming a loose which can be cumbersome. Aside from that blunder I wish there were places to hang bags or a cup holder for either mom/dad or low near the toddler.
customer_reviews.author: N E Eccles

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! As for the stroller itself- the bear flat ...
customer_reviews.text: So upset with this purchase! Ordered the stroller for a trip after a lot of research. The stroller arrived and i immediately opened and took my daughter for a walk to get her used to it before our vacation. The canopy and entire backside have water mark stains on them. for the price of the item I except something new and not damaged. Disappointed! As for the stroller itself- the near flat recline is a joke. Not even close! And honestly, the seat is sooooo shallow! She is 8 months and has no where to sit it’s almost uncomfortable to use. Plus- it is a super compact fold and is really lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller to be used as a “travel” stroller so I knew I was giving up storage and bells & whistles. However, the seat is also VERY shallow so it’s not comfortable and relaxing for my daughter. Also, the clasps that fit into the body harness come apart EVERY time you fold it so you have to tinker with them and try to figure out how to make them fit one another...It had good reviews online but I would not buy it again had I seen it in person.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Burkart Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller for travel!
customer_reviews.text: Love how compact this is. It folds so easy you can do it with one hand. It worked great on vacation since we were able to fold it up pretty quickly when we went into crowded restaurants and put it aside/under the table. The backpack storage bag it comes with is great for gate checking or garage/car storage. We have a bob stroller (we love it) but it’s 3 times bigger than this one so not as practical. The storage is pretty small but it seems worth the sacrifice. The handle doesn’t adjust which is a bummer but not a huge problem. I’m 5’6” my husband is 6’0” and it works well enough for us both.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P.

customer_reviews.title: I like the stroller because of it compact size and fold
customer_reviews.text: I like the stroller because of it compact size and fold. But it does not unfold smoothly. It is the most aggravating thing ever! I am not sure if it just my particular stroller or if all of them are like it but that is one of the quirks I am not happy with. Overall it is a great compact travel stroller. Note that there is not much storage space at all. An average diaper bag will NOT FIT.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Easy for traveling
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for traveling. It folds nicely and fits in the carry on compartment of the plane. It has made getting though the airport with my 11 month old so much easier. It is well made as well. I am glad I spent extra on this one instead of buying a cheap umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Travel
customer_reviews.text: I travel multiple times with my daughter and was sold on the fact it would fit in the overhead of a plane. Please note that it will not fit in the overhead where the plane is only 2 seats on each side. I would not recommend going through baggage claim as it did put a tiny hole in the carry case. I absolutely love the compact design. It doesn't take up too much space like my larger everyday stroller, so it's perfect for quick trips and travel. I do recommend getting a drink holder for some additional storage space. This stroller is a great secondary stroller or everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller folds so small, yet doesn't feel flimsy or look cheap. Maneuvers nicely, beautiful color, nice sunshade. It would have been nice if it came with the accessories that others in this category have (belly bar/snack tray/etc.) I was not looking to replace my traditional travel system, just needed something small and durable for quick outings that wasn't too pricey so this works perfect for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Destiney

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice stroller to have for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice stroller to have for traveling. We bought this when my daughter was 9 months old. We were looking for a stroller that would easily fold-up and could be put in the overhead bin of an airplane. This stroller definitely hits that mark. I actually had people stop and inquire about my stroller. I do have two complaints. 1. The back does not drop as nicely as the City Jogger Mini. 2. The storage bin is not very deep. However, this makes sense for a traveling stroller.
customer_reviews.author: BDZB

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really am in love with this stroller. Easy to fold and unfold. Lightweight. Very easy to push. Takes up very little room in the car. One hand steering and great turning capabilities. I can see this being in our family for a long time. My 8 month old is happy in and even my 4 year old can sit in the seat with no problems. Buying the parent console because the stroller did not come with a place to store cups or phones.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: 5 point harness broke in less than a day’s use
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing this review from the airport! We are on a 2 month trip, and we decided to get this instead of our vista stroller. It wasn’t a good decision. We received this yesterday and we were so excited. Alone today with my baby, one of the 5 point harness broke, and I had to tie it to another part so my baby doesn’t fall! Also maneuvering it is not very pleasant. I had high hopes, and now I’m just extremely annoyed and pissed off.
customer_reviews.author: Mama bear

customer_reviews.title: Good small travle stroller but bad quality!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this stroller for a trip. It is small, easy to fold, convient in every way. However after 4 week of use the brakes broke and could not be used. We called amazon and got a new through the warranty, which was great. The new stroller however lasted around 4 week again until the breaks broke again. A am truly sorry that the quality is so low, because I think it is a great travel stroller otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Beatriz probell

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this stroller. Love the colour. Love the easy fold. Love the small amount of room it takes up. Love how smooth it is to push. For a compact stroller that I brought with intention to take on a plane I feel it exceeds expectations on durability and all of what I love listed above. The only 2 things I would like to see changed would be for a belly bar to be included and 2 clasps that connect by the storage basket to possibly be re designed into a better position as it makes it difficult to put a small bag in the basket.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Silvester

customer_reviews.title: It does fold up very easy, the carrying backpack is awesome
customer_reviews.text: It does fold up very easy, the carrying backpack is awesome, I would definitely recommend for flights. Only negative is the slope of the seat is forward so if you have no choice but to use the seat belt. If you are using to hanging stuff off the handle you cannot do it with this one
customer_reviews.author: Jess Burston

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is really well built, the quality is evident the moment you begin to fold it's mechanisms. I purchased this for an upcoming strip the family is taking. The bag it comes with is great for storing the cart in the overhead compartment of a plan. I'll be sure to update this review after our trip if I notice something that merits a mention or update.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this first!!!
customer_reviews.text: We previously bought the summer infant travel stroller- huge mistake! This one allows you to open and close it without looking like a complete fool! Dealing with a difficult stroller and a toddler- no thank you!! I can’t believe how light and compact it is!!! A+++!!
customer_reviews.author: AMarie

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I was undecided between city tour and the citi mini. My family travels a lot and wanted something easy to travel with. I Was hesitant to buy after reading several comments but I bought anyway and figured I could return it if I didn’t like it. I used it on a 4day trip to Rome and my daughter loved it! It is lightweight and handles Rome’s cobbled streets well! I wish it came with storage compartments but I will be buying some of the accessories later on. Loved the stroller. A plus is that it fits on the overhead bins of the plane.
customer_reviews.author: Perla

customer_reviews.title: Used stroller ????
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the quality of the stroller i bought. This model is great for a toddler that still needs a stroller, not a huge storage area but bigger than most umbrella strollers. I would recommend this over an umbrella stroller for its better maneuverability. However just be warned this is a used listing!! This is a used stroller with baby drool and wear on the straps and head area. Thought i was buying a new stroller. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Meg Sways

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't 100% sure if I'd love this stroller because of all of the "too shallow" reviews. I love the Baby Jogger Summit jogging stroller and so I decided to give this a shot. And now it's grown on me!! Light, portable, sleek and my chubby baby loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Agnieszka

customer_reviews.title: Great compact stroller
customer_reviews.text: For it's size, I was pleasantly surprised at how well this maneuvers. My 2 year old is able to climb in and out and buckle it all alone! Makes for less fights when dealing with a toddler. Plus it folds so small it hardly takes up any time in my car!
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Easy fold. Super compact
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Easy fold. Super compact. Was great for travel and I thought the wheels did well. Cons - no cup holder for me, no child tray, bar is extra expense, seat leans down and without the strap the child would just slide out. Also small storage. Won't be replacing my uppa for everyday but nice for travel
customer_reviews.author: LDB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and lightweight to carry around
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and lightweight to carry around. Break open and fold down is simple and only takes a second. The carry bag is a nice touch to help carry and protect the stroller. Only downside is the seat is very shallow and is not comfortable for young ones when it is tilted back. Great for travel and errands, just not for babies and toddlers to sleep in if needed on long travel days.
customer_reviews.author: D.Michael81

customer_reviews.title: Good for European travel
customer_reviews.text: We got this stroller to get a 3 year old around while sightseeing in Europe. It's heavier than an umbrella stroller but about as easy to fold and definitely handled those cobblestones better than an umbrella stroller ever could. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: The Smiter of Tim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect travel stroller! I have taken it on many trips and am very pleased with it. It is easy to use and compact. It is much nicer than an umbrella stroller. It has storage underneath, which is perfect for travel. It fits in the overhead bin or underneath the seat on planes.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not so ergonomic!
customer_reviews.text: I like the compactness and ease of folding and carrying. But it’s main job is to have comfortable seating for my kid. It’s not comfy as my 2yr kid looks like sliding out and always on the edge clinging to the belt between his legs. His knees go high and not leveled in seated position which is not comfy
customer_reviews.author: ravicv

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller. We purchased this to use when we ...
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller. We purchased this to use when we fly and also when we go to Disney World. It is small and compact to travel. Only downside is that the seat is shallow. It is fine for us because our kid is small. It also allows for a larger weight than most. We checked out quite a few compactable strollers before deciding on this one. Came on time and accurate. Suggest.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have the larger Baby Jogger and now the mini. I like how small, compact and lightweight it is. You can fold it up and it has a case for carrying like a backpack which is nice for traveling. The only downfall is I wish the seat part was deeper. Definitely good for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: KSTEGS

customer_reviews.title: nice big canopy
customer_reviews.text: Compact, smooth ride, nice big canopy. We purchased for traveling and think it will be a great option- the bag it comes with is great and will serve its purpose for gate check. Our 9 month old fits well- the seat does seem a little shallow, but she isn't falling out like some reports. Once we travel and use it a bit more, will update if there are major problems. Highly recommend for size and quality!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous109

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it because it’s small and light weight (useful in airports).... It’s great for traveling...... small enough to leave space in the trunk... I found it for a great price of $140 here..... Buy buy baby had it for $250..... very easy to fold and unfold.....Stroller looks great in red.
customer_reviews.author: Krissia Benitez

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I find this stroller to be way overpriced for what you get. It’s easy to unfold and compacts down nicely but Is not comfortable to push. My six month old looks like he’s falling out of it as the seat is too shallow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: I received my stroller and the bag to carry it was damaged. I reached out to Baby Jogger via email and tried calling and was on hold for 20 minutes with no answer. Stroller is fine and moves easily, but the whole reason I purchased it was to carry it in the bag when not in use. Highly disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Megan M.

customer_reviews.title: could be a great stroller if there was not a design mistake
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is a great one except its seat. I believe it is designed for parents not for children because the only problem is that children cannot comfortably sit there. Seat is only 4 fingers wide and steep. Whenever my 9 month sits, he slides down. He cannot sit more than 10 minutes. If you consider your baby's comfort as me, then don't buy it. Other features of this stroller are great.
customer_reviews.author: Onur Gungor

customer_reviews.title: Seat is too shallow.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how this stroller has such great reviews... yes it is compact. Yes it is a smooth ride. Yes it is easy to open and close. BUT the seat is so shallow! My son is basically being held in by the seat belt. If I unbuckle the seat belt, he will fall right out. The two times I have used it, I have to recline the seat back so he can lay down, or else I’m scared he will fall out or have major seat belt wedgie. It’s very uncomfortable for him and unsafe in my opinion. I am returning it. (And I never return things)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with my new baby jogger. It is very easy to use, to open and to fold, and fits perfectly in my car! The one downside it does have is that it is best on flat cement otherwise it feels every bump in the road. You need to decide what is most important to you- how easy to use and small it folds or how comfortable the baby will be on roads that are not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Efrat Sa'ar

customer_reviews.title: Great travel stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is awesome for travel. It actually goes into the backpack really easily. So far I’m a big fan. Moves around really well, wheels don’t get stuck, and my daughter seems comfortable in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller ever
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my granddaughter before my daughter and her family traveled overseas and they loved it. Perfect travel stroller - lightweight but sturdy and well made. The carry bag is a real bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Sooooo confortable and worthy every penny
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Sooooo confortable and worthy every penny. Would just add a strap at the sides instead of the backpack that it comes with Great and solid for travelling by plane.1 hand to close it. A little bit more difficult to open it but greae
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller, easy and light
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller, easy and light. Just one issue I have with it is that it’s nit so comfortable for tall guys, I’m 6.4 and I would be very happy if the handle was a little taller. I recommend to try it out in a shop before buying. Other than that it’s a great stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: Rear wheel brakes stick on
customer_reviews.text: It was all good until one rear wheel brake wouldn’t disengage and had to take it apart and a part fell out and the whole assembly is a flimsy loose design
customer_reviews.author: NGL

customer_reviews.title: Take it anywhere u need to go
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller for easy travel needs. Folds down nice and small and can be placed anywhere. Its light weight and my wife likes the fact its not heavier than our son. A good tip, but the accessories. it comes in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ng

customer_reviews.title: Best light weight stroller ever
customer_reviews.text: Best light weight stroller ever! Perfect for city dwellers, that don't have much space to spare for a stroller. I use this as my everyday stroller to take the little one to daycare. It's light and easy to fold. However, I wished they would designed the seat to contour to a baby's head. It's flat, and my tot doesn't like to sit back on it.
customer_reviews.author: Begs4Games

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous and convenient, and light!
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I love how small it folds up. I didn't want an umbrella stroller b/c the long wheels get my coat arms all gross (have to cram everything in front closet). It's a one hand fold, is decent on the sidewalk. I got it for my 2 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D

customer_reviews.title: We have to have amazon come and pick up cause we cant close it and put back in the box - a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: maybe ours was defective. but it never closed. We have to have amazon come and pick up cause we cant close it and put back in the box - a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Aller

customer_reviews.title: Great travel stroller
customer_reviews.text: A great travel stroller. Love the size of the stroller when folded. Easy to carry and my son loves riding around in it. My only issue is that it seems it is not for everyday use due to wear and tear, also the city tour 2 came out shortly after at a much higher price with features city 1 should have had (like seat depth, compatibility for car seat, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Adkins

customer_reviews.title: I love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: We are heading to NYC and MD this April . It took me 2 weeks to finally decide if I should buy it or now since it was $165.43 then. Glad I did though! Highly recommend to anyone who travels a lot with their toddler. I also bought the belly bar for it so I can hang some of my daughter’s toys while we walk around the NYC!
customer_reviews.author: Oceans

customer_reviews.title: Tipping Hazard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this stroller.... But it fell flat. Literally. This thing would tip if my daughter moved at all. It felt seriously unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: thaney

customer_reviews.title: This is the stroller you’ve been looking for!!!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT stroller - I am obsessed. My tall, heavy almost 4 year old fits into it comfortably and the stroller is easy to steer (one handed with a coffee in the other 😂) and it folds one handed and is so light. I can’t wait to travel with it!!! A life saver.
customer_reviews.author: GypsyGirl24

customer_reviews.title: Super small to travel with- amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Love how small this folds up! Love that it comes with a bag to pack in which is also a back pack for travel! So convenient!!!!! Love that the seat adjusts back and baby can nap! Also bin on bottom is nice and roomy! After using it for a week breaking the stroller down becomes harder as is not best quality. Wish the stroller handles faced the other way to see your baby. I wish the leg bench lifted up so baby could nap laying flat!
customer_reviews.author: Christine J. Curran

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is my 3rd one and finally a great buy! We love it! It’s so practical for the tiny spaces in our community. I love how easy it is to fold. My baby enjoys it too. It reclines nicely for nap time. I only wish the canopy was a bit bigger.
customer_reviews.author: kristopher c.

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller, shallow seat
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome and easy to use stroller! It is not Tippy like most, very light and easy to fold. My only complaints are that the seat is shallow (it fits my 2 year old but any bigger and it could be uncomfortable) and the handle bar is hard to grab with the canopy back. Over all I love the stroller, but if you have bigger kids I would recommend the Zoe stroller.
customer_reviews.author: MamaS14

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Happy!
customer_reviews.text: So, my husband & I are anti stroller and we and our son love this thing. We travel constantly and it FOLDs amazing and is light & functional. It works in streets & gravel and is super easy to throw in the bag to Gate Check unpack and fling out in a snap! The bag could have a bit more durable zipper but overall it’s unbelievable!
customer_reviews.author: chris w miller

customer_reviews.title: Garnet=red.☹️😠
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed because the color on the model shows a orangeish kinda of color and when I received the package the stroller was a bright red. Not what I had in mind whatsoever but needed this for a trip so don’t buy garnet if you don’t want red 😟😔. Giving it a not so good as far as delivery on color is not related to the one online
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Travel
customer_reviews.text: traveled with this stroller super lightweight, convenient with the back pack carrier and great for nyc when taking the trains
customer_reviews.author: krista

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly compact when folded up and super comfortable for on the go. Easy to open and close. Bonnet is plenty. Just not built for all the extras like cupholders and large storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!!! you can lock and unlock front wheels. I feel maybe the seat ort isnt deep enough but not terrible. Easy to fold down with one hand. Highly recommended. The fabric is god quality and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Petite International

customer_reviews.title: Good for small spaces and travel
customer_reviews.text: Super small and easy to fold and store. Also easy to maneuver and I love that it has a large sunshade. The storage is minimal and the foot test does not recline but If you need a stroller that is compact yet a good quality this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Jo C

customer_reviews.title: Great travel stroller for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this stroller. I was nervous that it had a narrow seat and wouldn't be comfortable for me 2 year old, but she likes it. it folds up small, can be transported easily, and it's a nice looking stroller! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Elana Kohn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: So far we are LOVING our new stroller. It’s so tiny compared to what we had before and doesn’t take up half of my highlander trunk space. She sat in it to watch TV and wouldn’t get out. 😂
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey McMahan

customer_reviews.title: Nice, lightweight stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice stroller if you don't want a tray on the front. It folds well, is very lightweight, and moves nicely. I returned it because of the tray issue.
customer_reviews.author: Don Mecomber

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk!
customer_reviews.text: I love the simpleness to fold this stroller, but unfolding it is another matter. You definitely need 2 hands free to unfold it and pull it apart. I'm also disappointed in the quality of the materials. The fabric where the "joints" are, where the stroller folds, has already started fraying and pulling apart on both sides and it just keeps getting worse. Like the fabric is almost completely unraveling. The same for the mesh down by the foot rest. Overall, knowing what I know now I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recline and hard folding
customer_reviews.text: It’s not recline as showered by seller and definitely not one hand folding. The sit is too small for my 20 month baby. I love the color but that’s it. Returned just after receiving.
customer_reviews.author: Olena

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller! It's so smooth and amazing for traveling. I do wish my baby could lay flatter but for a compact stroller it does enough. They should at least provide a cup holder but it comes with none
customer_reviews.author: all.around.the.world

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect travel or active stroller. Easy to fold and easy to handle when moving around, fits in overhead space of any plane.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Pointdujour

customer_reviews.title: A very nice LIGHT weight stroller.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lightweight, very easy to carry, smooth, nice handle, bigger storage than expected, folds up very easily, has a good feel when pushing, sturdy. Cons: Wished the seat had more depth and relined further. No cup holder. Conclusion: Perfect stroller to keep in the car. A very very nice LIGHT weight-stroller thats easier to carry than most umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.author: stewart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight compact stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Really great lightweight stroller! The storage bag under doesn’t seem big, but don’t be fooled, it can hold quite a bit! The stroller is very light and folds easily. We used this stroller to travel to Disneyland and it was great! Love how it’s near flat recline and how big the canopy is as well!
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST PURCHASE !!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this stroller, I bought it for a trip and it was the best purchase because it is super practical, comfortable, easy to store and take out !!! the maximum I recommend it with closed eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Best travel stroller ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for our international travel and fit nicely in overhead compartments-even on smaller planes. Won't travel without it ! Super smooth ride and did well on a hike. Love this stroller !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is cery compact and easy to open and fold and the large canopy is a plus. I have seen reviews about how small the seat is but honestly I have had no issues. My son is 20 months old and 28 pounds and he fits in it perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Caprial Jones

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, it's very compact, seems to be of good quality and most importantly our daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Erlyn T

product_meta.title: Baby Jogger City Tour Stroller | Compact Travel Stroller | Lightweight Baby Stroller with Backpack-Style Carry Bag, Perfect for Travel, Garnet
product_meta.description: Color:GarnetFolds small for big adventures. The City Tour stroller is the ultimate travel companion. This fully featured stroller includes a near flat recline, UV 50+ extended canopy, and a comfortable, padded seat. At only 14 lb, it folds down small and meets carry-on requirements for many modes of transportation. A convenient backpack-style carry bag comes with the stroller, and an onboard storage compartment within the under seat basket allows it to be stored away when strolling. Add-on accessories allow for easy customization of the City Tour stroller so you're equipped to carry on with your day, wherever it may lead you.
feature_bullets: Easy and compact portable stroller features a one hand quick fold; auto lock locks the fold for transportation or storage
Multi position near flat recline; the canopy stroller includes a UV 50+ sun canopy with canopy extension and peek a boo window; stroller seat features 5 point harness
Folding stroller fits neatly into the backpack style carry bag, included with stroller; convenient under seat storage basket provides space for baby's extras

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars510 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
